sub_title: Senior Management Consultant at Capgemini Invent | Project manager | Data consultant | Photographer | Geoscientist
summary:
Management Consultant, Geoscientist, Data Science consultant, Hobby Photographer, Martial Art practitioner.
 
Ambition to contribute to innovative strategy and exploitation of new technology as a management consultant in strategy and data science. Experience in CPRD, financial services, the mining industry (resource economics and ore deposits), geoscience (geochemistry, geology, geophysics) and geospatial (remote sensing, GIS). Worked on over 20 projects with intercultural groups, and active as Diversity Ambassador and Holland Ambassador.

Personal strengths are technical know-how & complex problem solving. Additional experience with data mining, machine learning and analysis of large and complex datasets. Interdisciplinary background with strong interests in information systems in addition to a strong academic expertise in Earth Sciences. 

Current aim is the implementation of technical, analytical and scientific skills in projects for innovation and strategy, examples being modernization of the mining and energy industry and finding new solutions in (sustainable) energy (e.g. geothermal). In addition I am a strong proponent for effective (multifaceted) diversity policies.

MSc ETH Graduate in Earth Sciences, Cum Laude BSc (hons) in Earth Sciences, exchange in the United States, New Mexico.

Interests: Photography (Sony A6500), martial arts, languages and cultures, planetary science, innovation & technology, philosophy.

treasury_media.title: Stromboli, Italy - Fieldwork
treasury_media.description: One of the reasons Earth Sciences is so extremely interesting, you see it everywhere! Combining it with a passion for travel, culture, food and photography makes it even more exciting.

awards.title: ECHO Bèta-Techniek Award 2016 Nominee
awards.description: Nominated for the Echo diversity awards in the category Science (Bèta), by the VU Amsterdam, and selected as a finalist.

awards.title: Cum Laude
awards.description: All grades above a 7.0/10.0 and an average grade above 8.0/10.

awards.title: Honours degree
awards.description: Received the honours distinction in addition to my B.Sc. degree. Awarded to student who have accomplished more than average, including a minimum of 30 ECTS extracurricular and a high GPA.

awards.title: Holland Scholarship
awards.description: Scholarship of €1250,- and specifically for excellent students going abroad / on exchange (in my case the University of New Mexico), awarded by EP-Nuffic / the Dutch government.

certifications.name: Professional Scrum Product Owner™ I (PSPO I)

projects.title: Geochemical signatures of plume-induced subduction: numerical model and implications for the Caribbean Large Igneous Province (CLIP)
projects.description: Using a finite-difference approach (I3ELVIS, T. Gerya) to model subduction initiation. Incorporating a novel approach to trace the evolution of the (simplified) geochemistry of the system and compare this with geochemical field data. Involves data acquisition, coding in C and data analysis and visualizing.

contributors.headline: Senior Management Consultant at Capgemini Invent | Project manager | Data consultant | Photographer | Geoscientist

projects.title: Comparison of Kos and Nisyros rhyolites A regional study on the geochemistry, petrology and magmatic processes of high silica rocks in the Kos-Nisyros Volcanic Center, Aegean Arc, Greece.
projects.description: Geochemical and petrological study on the Kos-Nisyros volcanic center (KNVC) as part of the BSc Thesis. In this study the focus was on the rhyolite domes, and comparison of petrological and geochemical data. The research consists of fieldwork and XRF Analyses. Supervised by Davies, G.R. and Vroon, P.Z, and also supported by Boehm, K.

contributors.headline: Senior Management Consultant at Capgemini Invent | Project manager | Data consultant | Photographer | Geoscientist

projects.title: The effects of sulfur and silicate melt composition on the metal-silicate partitioning of siderophile (and chalcophile) elements Mo, Ni, Co, W, P, Cr, Mn, V & Ge and its relevance for core formation in smaller-sized planetary bodies
projects.description: Honours-BSc thesis, in addition to the BSc thesis. In this research project, I looked at the metal-silicate partitioning of a series of elements under high pressure and temperature. The data gained from this thesis is used for modelling of planetary core formation, and is part of a larger dataset. Research in the field of planetary science and experimental petrology. Supervised by Steenstra, E.S. and Westrenen, W. van

contributors.headline: Senior Management Consultant at Capgemini Invent | Project manager | Data consultant | Photographer | Geoscientist

projects.title: General compositional analysis and chemical-based classification of Lunar meteorite RED-1 with the Electron Probe Microanalyzer (JEOL)
projects.description: Electron Microprobe analysis on a new lunar meteorite sample (RED-1), geochemical data processing and meteorite classification at the Department of Earth and Planetary Sciences, University of New Mexico. Supervised by Spilde, M. and Agee, C.B.

contributors.headline: Senior Management Consultant at Capgemini Invent | Project manager | Data consultant | Photographer | Geoscientist

publications.name: The effect of melt composition on metal-silicate partitioning of siderophile elements and constraints on core formation in the angrite parent body

authors.headline: Senior Management Consultant at Capgemini Invent | Project manager | Data consultant | Photographer | Geoscientist
MSc Solid Earth at VU University Amsterdam

profile_positions.description: Senior Management Consultant in Enterprise Transformation, specifically Enterprise Data & Analytics. Focus on data (science), analytics and strategy.
profile_positions.title: Senior Management Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Management Consultant in Strategy and Data Science, focus on enterprise transformation, data & analytics
• Facilitated interviews on business requirements with board-level stakeholders in the analytics domain in companies in Financial Services, Public Sector, CPRD and Energy & Utilities.
• Developed finance and management information dashboards in an agile way using Power BI, taking into account privacy & security, coupling of complex data sources and requirements (KPIs) of business stakeholders
• Developed a Python model that assigns a sustainability rating (NLP & text analytics)
• Involved in the energy and utilities practice and in sustainability initiatives (i.e. energy transition)
• Certified in process mining (Celonis) and applied to clients in CPRD and Energy & Utilities sectors.
• Supported Capgemini NL with the signing of the Diversity Charter (SER), the ECHO Mentoring Program and the national D&I agenda in alignment with key stakeholders. Additional efforts in (global) marketing and branding initiatives for Capgemini Invent.
profile_positions.title: Management Consultant (Data Science & Strategy)

profile_positions.description: Focus on the business aspect of process mining (Celonis) from an enablement point of view with stakeholders in the entire bank within scope.
profile_positions.title: Business Analyst Process Mining (consultant)

profile_positions.description:
i.s.m. Digitaal Zuid-Holland
Focus on data strategy and a digital roadmap for short, mid and long term.
profile_positions.title: Strategy Consultant

profile_positions.description:
• Supported the change team with insights into throughput (times) for the core process for large consumers, reconstructions and grids with multiple data tools (i.e. Celonis Process Mining, PowerBI, Python, Excel), in line with the ambition to accelerate the energy transition
• Constructed action plans for process mining and data-driven process improvement
profile_positions.title: Data Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Main task of delivering standards and principles for scaling up process mining and working on development and implementation of a customer-oriented proof of concept dashboard in Celonis.
• Defined standards and guidelines for a global CoE for process mining while aligning with senior stakeholders throughout the organization with the aim to measure and improve top and bottom line performance and customer excellence.
• Analyzed the order-to-cash process, tasks ranging from data modeling and structuring (SQL), automation (next best action) to (visual) analytics and process mining. 
• Developed a demo proof of concept consisting of data from multiple source systems.
profile_positions.title: Process Mining Specialist (consultant)

profile_positions.description:
Product specialist role in Ingka Group Digital in the Inventory and Logistics Operations (ILO) domain, specifically in the insights and analytics domain (i.e. data science, PowerBI Reporting).
• Focus on identifying business needs, analytics requirements and stakeholder alignment.
• Gathered business requirements and defined key business capabilities for the customer fulfilment business for product strategy and a backlog for agile development. 
• Worked on the data, insights and analytics scope (i.e. business intelligence) in the IKEA global inventory and logistics operations for stores and central warehouses.
profile_positions.title: Product Specialist (consultant)

profile_positions.description:
Enterprise Analytics Architecture in the scope of the Analytics Transformation Office
• Facilitated interviews on business requirements with board-level stakeholders in the analytics domain in Rabobank to streamline the analytics pipeline
• Aided the analytics transformation officer with the development of the Enterprise Architecture, the transformation vision and the short and long-term analytics strategy.
profile_positions.title: Strategy consultant (Analytics, Enterprise Transformation)

profile_positions.description:
Volunteer at Maximo Nivel and at Panthera Sanctuary
https://www.linkedin.com/company/panthera-sanctuary/
• Assisting in remote Andean Quechua village ”Umasbamba” while improving Spanish skills.
• Conserving of flora and fauna in the Peruvian Amazon, consisting of scientific surveys and monitoring, and development of a self-sustaining environment.
profile_positions.title: International Volunteer (Jungle Conservation)

profile_positions.description:
Scientific researcher in the Institute of Geophysics, Department of Earth Sciences. 
• Research funded by Swiss and International AlpArray Project, Geodynamics of Alpine Orogeny. 
• Focus on supervising BSc/MSc projects, 3D numerical simulations, code versioning and publishing of results.
profile_positions.title: Scientific Researcher

profile_positions.description:
MSc Thesis with Prof. T. Gerya and Dr. Esteban Gazel.
Preparing MSc Thesis results for peer-reviewed publication and presentation at large scientific
conferences (American Geophysical Union Fall Meeting 2018).

Finite-difference modelling of geochemical signatures in a 3D plume-induced subduction initiation model (I3LVIS, by T. Gerya) using C. Combined current research at the Institute of Geophysics with principles in Geochemistry. Coded a novel algorithm in the I3ELVIS code. Utilized parallel computing on the ETH Euler Cluster to run optimized finite-difference models written in C. Analyzed and visualized resulting data. Processed results through scientific writing and presentation.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Researcher in the Institute of Geophysics

profile_positions.title: Project Manager at HöNK

volunteer_experiences.description: Mentoring program with a focus on cultural diversity. Main objective is supporting a mentee that identifies as having a non-western background with orienting themselves in the Dutch labor market.

volunteer_experiences.role: Student member of the Educational Committee of BSc Earth Sciences
volunteer_experiences.description: Monitor the quality of education and discuss study-related subjects. Another main task is to solve the problems that students and/or teachers have and improve the quality of the study as a whole.
Representing the Honours Programme of the Faculty of Earth and Life Sciences on the VU/Amsterdam and improving it.
Representing the students of BSc Earth Sciences cohort '13/'14.
